results.title: Dr Seuss on the loose: Sneetches
results.creator_credit: CBS, Isadore Freleng, Ted Geisel and Hawley Pratt
results.brief_description: Animated version of the Dr Seuss story from “Dr Seuss on the Loose”. This film implies that differences are only relative and in essence don’t matter. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: Dr Seuss' butter battle book
results.brief_description: The Butter Battle is the story of a war between the Yooks and the Zooks. The Yooks butter their bread butter-side-up, and the Zooks butter-side-down. At first they fought with sticks and stones, but their weapons became more and more sophisticated until one day they met to fight using the ultimate weapon - the Big Boy Boomeroo. A lighthearted parable on the dangers of the arms race based on the book by Dr Seuss.

results.title: Dr Robert Simpson
results.creator_credit: Harold Mayer, Kenneth Vose and United States Information Agency
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “One Man”.
Dr Robert Simpson is the director of the National Hurricane Watch Centre at the University of Miami. He discusse his responsibility for tracking hurricanes which originate in the south east Atlantic and for warning the public along the Eastern Atlantic Coast on the intensity and course which the hurricanes will takes. Narrated by Barry Sullivan. Written by Kenneth Vose.

results.title: Dr Plughole
results.brief_description: Matthew’s evening bath is interrupted by a visit from the water wizard Dr. Plughole. Combining animation and live action into comic adventure, “Dr. Plughole” shows young Matthew how exciting the water cycle is and how important it is for our everyday lives. Principles covered are evaporation, condensation and precipitation.

results.title: Dr Phil's story
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Phil Bergman and ACMI
results.brief_description: Dr Phil Bergman is a pediatrician and endocrinologist. He was encouraged to become involved with the Victorian Turner’s Syndrome Association and has since become a specialist in the field. Over the years he has contributed greatly to the care of those with Turner’s Syndrome and values support for those with the condition as much as medical advancements in the area.

results.title: Dr Petiot
results.creator_credit: MS Productions, Sara Films, Cine 5, Canal+, Alain Sarde, Philippe Chapelier-Dehesdin and Christian de Chalonge
results.brief_description: Michel Serrault gives an extraordinary perfomance as ‘Dr Petiot’, a serial killer who lured Jews into his trap by offering them protection from the Nazis. The film’s expressionistic quality, emphasised by the heavy make-up of Petiot, and the deep focus photography, gives the film a nightmare quality reminiscent of the early German silent horror films. Indeed the film opens with scenes from one such film, plunging us into a world of evil. Based on a true character, Serrault’s perfomance is chilling.

results.title: Dr Mabuse: the fatal passions
results.brief_description: The feature version of the two-part ‘Dr Mabuse: The Gambler’ edited into one movie. Dr. Mabuse is a master criminal and overlord of the social chaos in Berlin who uses hypnosis, disguise and deception in his quest for wealth and power. As much a social portrait as a thriller, this is an early example of the suitability of the thriller genre as a vehicle for Lang’s world view, a world in which nothing is as it seems, where danger lurks beneath the most seemingly normal circumstances and objects, and individual destinies are controlled and threatened by mysterious and powerful forces. This is an early demonstration of a key Langian theme: the complete unreliability of appearances. With English intertitles and musical accompaniment. Cast includes Rudolf Klein-Rogge, Ause Egdse Nissem, Paul Richter, Bernhard Goetzke. Reference: Julian Petley, BFI Distribution Library Catalogue. WITH MUSICAL SOUNDTRACK.

results.title: Dr Leakey and the dawn of man
results.creator_credit: Nicolas Noxon and National Geographic Society
results.brief_description: Highlights the discoveries of Dr Leakey and their implications for the study of human origins. Traces the development of the first theories about both the emergence of humans and their place of origin and examines the application of modern technology to the study of anthropology. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Dr Jekyll and Mr Hyde. - [Edited version]
results.creator_credit: Saul J. Turell, Paul Killiam and Paul Killiam Film Classic
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History of the Motion Picture”.
This 1920’s film with John Barrymore was the first great American horror film. It was a tour-de-force for Barrymore, and a classic of macabre film making. This edited work retains all the ingredients for which it is famous. The narration points out its significance in motion picture history and provides interesting comment on the craftsmen who made it.

results.title: Dr Jekyll and Mr Hyde
results.creator_credit: Victor Saville, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer and Victor Fleming
results.brief_description:
As part of an experiment to separate the good and bad sides of men’s souls, Dr Harry Jekyll drinks his own potion and turns into Mr Hyde, his evil self. When his fiancee is taken abroad, the lonely Jekyll turns to Hyde for release. He ensnares a pretty barmaid and keeps her a virtual prisoner. Hyde soon begins to overpower Jekyll, and the doctor becomes trapped in a vortex of cruelty and murder.
Cast includes: Spencer Tracy, Ingrid Bergman, and Lana Turner.
